channel.title: Compiler Isn't Working
channel.description: I have JRE 6u16 and i tried with JDK 6u16. But when i download the file it downloads to is called like jre6 or something so i rename it to, Jre1.6.0_16 for jre or jdk1.6.0_16 for jdk. I'll post a few screenies below to show you. [IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/14mugs3.jpg[/img][IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/34e6ckl.jpg[/img] Thats whats in my jre1.6.0_16 and my compiler and what it says, Thanks in advance.

item.title: Compiler Isn't Working
item.dc:creator: @xXx_gl0wi_xXx xXx gl0wi xXx
item.description:
@xXx_gl0wi_xXx wrote:

Whats the point in ur older post he already got it fixed

[quote=“ollie123, post:14, topic:309076”]Try changing “C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe” in your compiler to “C:\Program Files\Java[b]jdk[/b]1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe”

However, I would still recommend setting your environmental variables. There is a tutorial on this site for it somewhere.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Isn't Working
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

alrighty… this is my little tut on how to set up your javac:

open up control panel then system>advanced system settings>environmental variables

now there will be two boxes: user variables and system variables
you want to add two things to user variables so under its box hit new…
now you will have variable name and variable value;
for variable name you need to put CLASSPATH and for the value put this:
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
now hit ok

now we need to make another one also in user variables so once again, hit new… and this time for variable name type: PATH
and for the value put this: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin

—Notes— 1. the words CLASSPATH and PATH must be capital for them to work
2. The reason they are set to bin is because in that folder its contains possibly the most exciting thing for a newbie coder: JAVAC!!!

Hope this helped ya,

—James—

Read full topic
